body_html: What I've issued is tf.one_hot is perfectly allocate to /GPU:0 on Linux, but it can not be allocated on WIndows environment. I think the GPU kernel for Windows is not developed or have some error. And it makes 4~5 times slower on Windows than I have run on Linux when I allocated CPU for tf.one_hot module.
body_text: What I've issued is tf.one_hot is perfectly allocate to /GPU:0 on Linux, but it can not be allocated on WIndows environment. I think the GPU kernel for Windows is not developed or have some error. And it makes 4~5 times slower on Windows than I have run on Linux when I allocated CPU for tf.one_hot module.
body: What I've issued is `tf.one_hot` is perfectly allocate to `/GPU:0` on Linux, but it can not be allocated on WIndows environment. I think the GPU kernel for Windows is not developed or have some error. And it makes 4~5 times slower on Windows than I have run on Linux when I allocated CPU for `tf.one_hot` module.
